intro: Anemone coronaria var. pluriflora, commonly known as the Multiflora Crown Daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pink flowers surrounded by a ring of yellowish-orange bracts, giving it a daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Its foliage consists of basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. This variety is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate, early spring blooms.
